1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
delightful (objective or subjective, literal or figurative)

2.brief: Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

3.brief: properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule
a idol; also, a pain or wound

4.brief: properly, to weigh out; by implication, to allot or constitute officially; also to enumerate or enroll
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

5.brief: great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration

6.brief: to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

9.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

10.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt

11.brief: to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

12.brief: properly, to address in aloud tone, i.e. (specifically) loud; figuratively, to pacify (as if by words)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
an opening, i.e. door or gate
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

14.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part
wheat, whether the grain or the plant
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

15.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

16.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, a cover, i.e. (by implication) a tankard (or covered goblet); also white frost (as covering the ground)
to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty

17.brief: to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
ice (as if bald, i.e. smooth); hence, hail; by resemblance, rock crystal
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

18.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to blow; by implication, to disperse

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to drip, or shed by trickling
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

19.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

20.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
